clinical_study.brief_title: Using Spectrally Encoded Confocal Microscopy (SECM) to Image the Esophagus
clinical_study.official_title: Pilot Study to Image the Esophagus Using Spectrally Encoded Confocal Microscopy (SECM)

collaborator.agency: National Institute of Diabetes and Digestive and Kidney Diseases (NIDDK)

brief_summary.textblock: The goal of this study is to test the feasibility and the tolerability of a tethered spectrally encoded confocal microscopy (SECM) capsule and to use it to image the esophagus.

detailed_description.textblock:
72 subjects including healthy volunteers, patients with a suspicion of having Eosinophilic Esophagitis (EoE) and patients with a clinical diagnosis of EoE will be recruited and asked to swallow the SECM capsule while being awake and unsedated. The capsule is attached to a tether which allows the operator to control as well as navigate the capsule as it progresses down the esophagus using natural propulsive force called peristalsis.
As the capsule progresses, multiple 2-dimensional cross sectional images of the esophagus are acquired. Images are analyzed at a later stage.

primary_outcome.measure: Measure the tolerability of SECM Capsule and imaging in healthy subjects as well as patients with Eosinophilic Esophagitis.
primary_outcome.time_frame: Images will be acquired during the SECM imaging session and should take an average of 10 minutes.
primary_outcome.description: After participating in the study, the subject will be asked for feedback about tolerability of the procedure using a questionnaire.

secondary_outcome.measure: Measure the feasibility of SECM Capsule and imaging in healthy subjects as well as patients with Eosinophilic Esophagitis.
secondary_outcome.time_frame: Measure the feasibility of SECM Capsule and imaging in healthy subjects as well as patients with Eosinophilic Esophagitis.
secondary_outcome.description: An investigator will assess the quality of the recorded images and movies obtained with each exam after the imaging is completed. The images obtained by the SECM Capsule will be compared to the images obtained by clinical endoscopy if available.

arm_group.description: Subject will swallow the SECM capsule and Imaging will be performed using the SECM Imaging system.

intervention.description: Imaging of the esophagus using the SECM capsule and system

criteria.textblock:
Inclusion Criteria:
- Subject must be a healthy volunteer
- OR subject must have a suspicion of EoE
- OR subject must have a prior clinical suspicion of EoE
- Subject must be older than 14 years of age
- Subject must be able to give informed consent
Exclusion Criteria:
- Subjects with the inability to swallow pills and capsules.
- Esophageal fistula and/or esophageal strictures with a stricture diameter that is smaller than the diameter of the capsule.
